awd_titl_txt: Advanced Research Workshop: The Last Deglaciation: Absolute and Radiocarbon Chronologies
awd_abstract_narration: This award supports the travel of US scientists to a NATO                       workshop:  Advanced Research Workshop:  The last deglaciation:                  absolute and radiocarbon chronologies.  The purpose of the                      meeting is to discuss the variations in the atmosphere's 14C/C                  ratio as determined from measurements on tree rings, corals, and                varied sediments and the possible causes for these changes.                     Experts in dendrochronology, geochronology, paleomagnetism and                  annually layered sediments will attend.  This topic is important                because it helps unravel the climate of the past 20,000 years.
org_div_long_name: Division of Atmospheric and Geospace Sciences

inst.inst_name: Columbia University Lamont Doherty Earth Observatory
